node.text: #Ad One of the most common questions I get is: "What camera do you use?" Truthfully, my setup includes many different models, but I always say that the best camera is the one you have on you. It has been a pleasure to introduce @SonyXperia's #Xperia1III to my photography toolkit, especially during a year when I have spent more time on the front lines of conservation with @SeaLegacy than any other in my life. How many of you find yourself shooting with your phones most often these days? @SonyXperiaUS #SonyXperia #TakenWithXperia #SonyArtisan #MobilePhotography #TheBahamas #SeaLegacy1 #Conservation #Photography #Storytelling

node.text: Until just recently, Vancouver Island’s landmass was almost entirely old-growth rainforest, yet only about 10% remains today thanks to industrial logging. These old trees play a critical role in boosting a forest’s immunity – when we lose them, we lose the blueprint of an entire ecosystem’s resilience. We cannot level what took hundreds, even thousands, of years for nature to perfect and expect it ever to recover, so we need your help. Governments and large corporations feel secure making harmful environmental decisions when allowed to operate in the shadows, often taking special measures to prevent the public from becoming aware of their actions. Well, we can see them now, and we are not about to let them get away with it. Please visit the link in my bio and urge BC officials to protect the last of our old-growth forests before it is too late. Video by @ReelWater. With @FairyCreekBlockade. #FairyCreekBlockade #FairyCreek #VancouverIsland #BC #BritishColumbia #Canada #Logging #Trees #Forests #AncientForests #OldGrowth #SaveOldGrowth #SaveOldGrowthNow #SaveFairyCreek #Conservation

node.text: 🔊 Please turn up your volume to learn about Timor-Leste's incredible marine ecosystems and get a behind-the-scenes look at our encounter with a magnificent blue whale. Looking into the eye of the largest animal that has ever lived on our planet and seeing them stare back was an experience that changed me forever. I have been fortunate enough to visit many unique locations, and I have seen some wonderful things in my career, but there are only a handful of memories I'll think about on my deathbed. This is one of them. The cobalt waters of Timor-Leste are abundant with an incredible variety of life, making responsible, sustainable ecotourism an ideal way for local communities to support themselves. Our objective at @sealegacy and @onlyone is to share the beauty and wonder of these faraway places so people everywhere will be inspired to stand up and protect them from the threat of climate change and other human-made issues. Please consider visiting the link in my bio and supporting our conservation mission by joining The Tide today. On expedition for @sealegacy in Timor-Leste with @mitty, @andy_mann, and @sonyalpha. #ShotOnSony #SonyAlpha #BeAlpha #whale #bluewhale #timorleste #life #beauty #conservation #bucketlist

node.text: There’s only one thing in wildlife and nature photography that really matters, and that’s the moment. Every situation that unfolds in front of me is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to tell a story that can connect a global audience to the most important issues facing our planet. There is always more than just my creative vision to consider, especially underwater – am I weighted properly, is everything working, where are the other divers, where are the other sharks. But if I can shoot 8K video and 50 MP stills with the same tool, I have one less thing to worry about and am free to go off and be an artist. Conservation and storytelling are my passions – it is a pleasure to have partners that make it easier to succeed. Shot on the new @sonyalpha α1 while on assignment for @sealegacy with @mitty, @andy_mann, and @samkretch. #shark #tigershark #bahamas #sealegacy1 #sony #sonyalpha #a1 #bealpha

node.text: 🔊 // Congratulations to @sonyalpha on the launch of their new α1 camera – please turn up your volume and enjoy this beautiful video about an epic milestone in photography. Cristina and I recently became some of the first people in the world to shoot with their new technology underwater, and it is already changing the way we see and think as photographers. I am especially excited because innovation like this results in an enhanced ability to do our conservation work better than ever before. As always, I am incredibly grateful to have a sponsor and partner that provides us with the best tools in the world to tell the planet's most important stories. #sony #sonyalpha #a1 #bealpha

node.text: The Galápagos is an invaluable and irreplaceable treasure of our ocean – a truly legendary World Heritage Site that is a refuge for 3,000 marine species. Yet, industrial and unsustainable fishing practices continue to plunder its waters and devastate its fragile ecosystem thanks to inaction from a government that has pledged to protect it. Please visit the link in my bio where you can show your support for additional protections by signing our petition – we need your help to ensure Ecuadorian President @leninmorenog and President of the National Assembly @cesarlitardo fulfill their commitment to expanding the Galápagos Marine Reserve before any further damage is done. With @onlyone and @sealegacy. @mas_galapagos2020 #masgalapagos #yoestoycongalapagos #galapagos #ecuador #gratitude

node.text: Today is @mitty's birthday. I am so fortunate and thankful to have a partner in life who not only matches my passion but magnifies it. Cristina is a caring mother, talented diver, fearless explorer, gifted photographer, and tireless conservationist. She is wise and kind, and leads with a gentle heart. She makes everyone around her better, myself included. Please consider celebrating her birthday with me by visiting the link in my bio and joining The Tide to support our conservation mission at @sealegacy and our activation platform, @onlyone – 100% of your contribution will go directly to projects and campaigns to rebuild marine life. As always, thank you for standing with us to protect the world's oceans – your support means the world to all of us. Feel free to leave a birthday message for her below, and I'll be sure she sees them. #onlyoneocean #birthday #partner #inspiration #luckyguy

node.text: The fjords of northern Norway are unlike any place on Earth. I have visited several times during my career and captured many of my proudest images there. Now, talk of seismic oil and gas exploration threatens to put Lofoten's enormous orca population at risk. I am excited to announce the upcoming @onlyone screening of our new short documentary film, 'Echoes in the Arctic,' on Tuesday, November 10th, at 7 pm ET (4 pm PT). Filmmakers @mitty, @andymaser, @tahriasheather, and I will be sticking around afterward for a live Q&A, so be sure to RSVP at the link in my bio – hope to see you there. #onlyoneocean #orca #lofoten #norway #documentary #filmmaking #climatechange #conservation #storytelling

node.text: 🔊 // Art and storytelling have sparked many beautiful relationships in my career, but few are as meaningful as this one. I have spent countless evenings sifting through my image library with @thelumineers blasting in the background, so to discover that @jeremiahfraites, co-founder of my favourite band, had one of my fine art pieces hanging on his wall was a wonderful surprise. Soon after connecting, I discovered we had much more in common than a healthy appreciation for each other's art. Jeremiah and his wife, @francesca_laz, are avid conservationists who care deeply about the same bears in Katmai, Alaska, that I have been obsessed with ever since photographing them in 1991, long before my @natgeo days. He recently sent me a demo of "Maggie" after divulging his upcoming solo project, and I instantly recognized it as an opportunity to collaborate. Today, I am proud to share the music video we crafted together. Most of this footage has never been seen outside the @sealegacy walls – it is a tribute to the intelligent, majestic, and vulnerable brown bears of Alaska. Together, we hope our art will inspire you to join us in a stand against the Pebble Mine development that threatens to wipe out their habitat. The time for action is now – visit the link in my bio to send a message to Senator Sullivan, Senator Murkowski, and the EPA today. Filmed on assignment for @sealegacy with @andymaser, @samkretch, and @kyle.roepke. #jeremiahfraites #thelumineers #maggie #pianopiano #newmusic #bear #brownbear #katmai #bristolbay #alaska #pebblemine #stoppebblemine #vetopebblemine #nopebblemine #shareyourbears #thinkaboutbears #art #collaboration #conservation #passion

node.text: 🔊 Please turn up your volume and come on a journey with me to witness the remarkable coastal wolves of British Columbia. // I am really proud of our small but mighty @sealegacy team when I see them create powerful and impactful storytelling pieces. Please watch the entire film and let me know your thoughts. @sealegacy and our partners at @raincoastconservation have a plan to end the commercial trophy hunting of wolves, bears, and wolverines in British Columbia’s Kitlope Conservancy permanently, but we need your help. Two very generous patrons have just confirmed they will donation-match half of the final $100,000 needed to buy up the remaining hunting licenses in the area, which would double the impact of your contribution. A good friend of mine and avid supporter of @sealegacy just came in for $20K. Please visit the link in my bio if you want to get involved in pushing this protection over the finish line so we can save this community of wolves. 🙏💙 Shot on assignment for @sealegacy with @johnkelseyphoto. Audio and BTS clips by @maxwelhohn, @steve_woods_photography, and @seaforthexpeditions. Edited by @chadrichmond. #wolf #coastalwolf #bear #wolverine #kitlopeconservancy #BC #canada #fundraiser #conservation #donation #gratitude

node.title: Help Us Save BC’s Coastal Wolves

node.text: 🔊 Sound on to hear @mitty tell the beautiful story of the Mermaids of Atauro – I couldn't resist lifting it from her account to share with all of you. I am always in awe of how easily she connects with people on expedition. Her energy is infectious, kind, and gentle – people invite her into their worlds the same way animals let me into theirs. It helps that she speaks several languages, Portuguese in this case. Next month, we board our boat and set off on assignment with the @sealegacy team to unearth more moments like this. In the meantime, click my bio link to sign up for @onlyone and watch more from "The Last Coral Kingdom" series on our 30x30 journey. // Reposted from @mitty: "'Obrigada pela natureza.' The song drifted across the sea from a woman moving waist-deep in the shallows of Timor-Leste, her voice rising gently with the rolling swells. I knew instantly who she was and waded out to her from shore, tears welling in my eyes as I recognized the meaning behind the Portuguese words. Spanning around her in a wide circle were a handful of tiny boats trailing baited hooks through the water, an ingenious fishing technique I had never seen before used by the Wawata Tapu; the Mermaids of Auturo. As I drew close, she smiled brightly and sang again, "Obrigada pela natureza, hallelujah!" A fisherwoman's hymn giving thanks to nature for providing for her family. A surge of hope flooded through me, and in that moment, I wanted the world to meet Sara. Today, you finally can." // With @samkretch, @andy_mann, and @mitty on assignment for @sealegacy. #onlyoneocean #30x30 #thelastcoralkingdom #mermaidsofauturo #timorleste

node.text: #Ad // I am very selective of the brands I choose to work with, and @NorthSails_Collection's support of initiatives like our dear friends at the @CoralGardeners reassures me that they were the right choice to outfit the @SeaLegacy 1 for our journey along the front lines of ocean conservation. Coral reefs are essential to life as we know it. Their delicate ecosystems support thousands of marine creatures and plants that, in turn, empower the ocean to produce more than half of the oxygen we breathe. Pollution, global warming, and overfishing place a massive burden on their well-being, however, and without dramatic action, between seventy and ninety percent of all coral reefs will disappear over the next twenty years. @Toutiess and his team of scientists, engineers, creators, and ocean advocates at @CoralGardeners have taken the future into their own hands, planting more than 150,000 corals around the island of Moorea. By 2025, they hope to have planted 850,000 more. Please visit the link in my bio to find out more. #NorthSailsCollection #NorthSailsXCoralGardeners #CoralGardeners #AdoptACoral #Coral #Ocean #Conservation

node.text: I have seen the devastation caused by California's 'deathnets' firsthand. Countless sea turtles, sea lions, whales, sharks, and other species are tangled in these nets every year, where they die a long, slow death before being cast back into the ocean – collateral damage of a wasteful, indiscriminate fishing practice. California banned the use of driftnets in state waters, but they are still allowed in federal waters thanks to Trump's veto of a 2020 bill that had already passed both houses in the United States Congress. That bill was recently reintroduced, giving us another chance to end the use of driftnets once and for all. Learn more about how you can help by joining @Mitty, @IAmAliTabrizi (director of @Seaspiracy), and @CSafina for a digital conversation this Thursday, September 9th, at 7:00 pm ET (4:00 pm PT). The link to sign up is in my bio – I would love to see you there. 🙏💙 #TalkAboutDriftnets #BanDriftets #Driftnets #Deathnets #California #Swordfish #SeaTurtles #SeaLions #Whales #Sharks #EndangeredSpecies #WeNeedYourHelp

node.text: I have wondered what it would be like to swim alongside Earth's greatest marine predators for as long as I can remember. Many species captured my imagination – the misunderstood great white shark and graceful, intelligent orca, for example. But I dreamt of encountering sperm whales, especially: leviathans of the deep that graced the pages of books like Jacques Cousteau's 'The Living Sea' and Herman Melville's 'Moby Dick.' I was fortunate to realize that dream years later in the crystal waters of Dominica, where @Mitty and I spent an afternoon photographing a mother sperm whale, Soursop, and her calf, Ariel. With @SeaLegacy. Filmed under a special interaction permit from the Dominican government. #Whale #SpermWhale #Dominica #Soursop #Ariel #Mother #Calf #EncounterOfALifetime #Gratitude

node.text: ⁠So much of wildlife photography is perseverance. On this particular assignment for @NatGeo, we spent ninety days searching British Columbia's rugged shoreline for signs of coastal wolves – an elusive community that feeds almost exclusively from the ocean. On eighty of those, we huddled in blinds as their howls carried over the water, on eight, we caught fleeting glimpses of them in the distance, and on just two, we got close enough to film. 'Sea Wolf of the Great Bear' required an investment of hundreds of hours trekking, tracking, and trying, again and again, to get it right, but the effort was worth it. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire print catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #Photography #Art #BW #BlackAndWhite #Wolf #SeaWolf #CoastalWolf #BC #BritishColumbia #Canada #Wildlife #Photography #Perseverance

node.text: ⁠Happy National Wildlife Day. If you spend enough time with our cousins in the animal kingdom, strange and wonderful behaviors will inevitably unfold in front of you. I remember marveling from a distance as this polar bear picked up a ball of snow and cradled it between furry arms like a teddy before drifting to sleep. I am grateful for having had the opportunity to witness so many unique moments in nature – I hope images like 'Snowball Reverie' allow you to share in them with me. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire print catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #Photography #Art #BW #BlackAndWhite #Bear #PolarBear #Manitoba #Canada #Snowball #Sleeping #Wildlife #Unique #Unexpected #Fortunate #Gratitude

node.text: ⁠Searching for patterns in nature is one of my favorite things to do as a photographer, and Antarctica's Iceberg Alley is a playground of order and chaos. It has been a privilege to spend countless hours here, obsessing over the endless variety of textures in the ancient ice as it slowly returns to the sea, each structure somehow more unique and perfect than the next. I couldn't help but smile at this ice mushroom as it jutted from the water against the backdrop of repeating horizontal lines that inspired the name 'On Many Levels' for this print. // To inquire about this piece or view my entire print catalog, please visit the link in my bio. #Photography #Art #Ice #Iceberg #Mushroom #IcebergAlley #Antarctica #Playground #Order #Chaos #IceIsMyObsession

node.text: @Mitty and I had a fantastic time visiting the @Hilton.Asmus.Contemporary gallery in Chicago last week for the opening of our 'Origins' exhibition. There is simply no substitute for seeing pieces like 'Dawn Patrol,' 'Ice Waterfall,' and 'Megaptera' as massive, life-size prints. It was a pleasure to meet everyone who attended in person – I have missed connecting with all of you over this last year and a half, and I'm excited for more opportunities to do so again soon. 'Origins' will continue to run until October 2nd, so please stop by to meet Arica and her team if you are in the neighborhood – details can be found at the link in my bio. #Photography #Art #Prints #LifeSize #Gallery #Opening #Exhibition #Gratitude

node.text: As we struggle to contain the COVID crisis, another pandemic silently rages in the waters of Canada's West Coast, where disease propagated by BC fish farms is slowly decimating wild salmon populations. As the salmon disappear, so do the orca and countless other species who depend on them to survive. @AlexMorton4Salmon is an icon in conservation circles – persistent, passionate, and powerful, a fierce warrior for our cause. She has co-authored more than twenty scientific papers on the impact of salmon farming on migratory salmon, founded the Salmon Coast Research Station, and been key to many legal and protest actions against the industry. Today, I am honored to share 'Not on My Watch' – a new book detailing her thirty years of experience with a finger on the pulse of this complicated issue. Please consider picking up a copy at the link in my bio to learn more. Thank you for your amazing work, my friend – we are all in your debt. @Oprah @OprahsBookClub #SalmonAreSacred #SaveWildSalmon #NotOnMyWatch #Fish #FishFarms #Salmon #AtlanticSalmon #WildSalmon #BC #Canada #Book #Thankful⁠

node.text: I have had the privilege of swimming with countless whale sharks in a variety of seas, including the 50-foot long, bus-sized females of the Galapagos Islands. Some scientific models suggest whale sharks can reach 130 years of age, but like many of our planet's most remarkable species, they are slowly succumbing to human-made pressures. International Whale Shark Day is a helpful reminder to stay one-hundred-percent focused and engaged with conservation, so the world's largest fish, among other species, will continue to have necessary protections. #InternationalWhaleSharkDay #Shark #WhaleShark #Galapagos #GalapagosIslands #Ecuador #Remarkable #Focused #Engaged #Conservation #Privilege #Gratitude

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Paul Nicklen in Manitoba. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text: I watched from afar as this 'Arctic Nomad' sniffed the cold, northern wind for signs of a seal while Canada's Hudson Bay slowly froze over. Polar ecosystems present many unique photographic opportunities, and one of my favorites is the uniformity of a white subject on a white background. High key images have an ethereal quality – I find that allowing details to gently fall away creates the sensation of revisiting a distant memory. In this case, a lack of contrast also demonstrates the effectiveness of polar bear camouflage: a distinct, white coat that has evolved over more than a hundred thousand years. // @Mitty and I are home from our trip to Chicago for the opening of 'Origins' at @Hilton.Asmus.Contemporary, but the exhibition will continue until October 2nd – please visit the link in my bio to learn more. #Bear #PolarBear #Churchill #Manitoba #Canada #Arctic #HighKey #WhiteOnWhite #DistantMemory #Evolution

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Paul Nicklen on August 28, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text: I am grateful that my art has provided a means to help shift our often misguided preconceptions about the animal kingdom. Walruses are a good example. As one of the world's largest pinnipeds, they can weigh up to 3,300 lbs (500 lbs more than the average car), and their pre-historic, saber-like tusks can grow up to more than three feet in length over a lifetime. Yet, despite their fearsome appearance, they are surprisingly gentle. This male in 'Solitude' was easily the largest walrus I had ever seen, but by contrasting his formidable presence with the serenity of an Arctic landscape, I hoped to portray him as the mellow, contemplative creature he truly was. // Thank you so much for a fantastic opening night of 'Origins' at the @Hilton.Asmus.Contemporary gallery in Chicago – please visit the link in my bio to learn more about the exhibition. #Walrus #Svalbard #Norway #Wildlife #AnimalKingdom #Preconceptions #Education #Conservation #GentleGiant

node.text: Sunlight fades behind distant mountains as a hunter from the northern village of Qaanaaq in Greenland leads his sled team on an 'Arctic Journey' across the sea ice and towards the floe edge. @Mitty and I had traveled to this snow-covered realm just 600 miles (970 km) south of the North Pole to capture stories of climate change in the Arctic. We returned home with many life-long friendships and countless images revealing the ancient relationship between Inuit culture and the unforgiving ice that shaped it. // We are excited to meet many of you tonight at the @hilton.asmus.contemporary in Chicago.  #Inuit #Huskies #Qaanaaq #Greenland #Arctic #Sled #Journey #ClimateChange #Relationship #Culture
